title: SemConvSpec
description: A semantic convention file as defined [here](https://github.com/open-telemetry/build-tools/blob/main/semantic-conventions/syntax.md) A semconv file is a collection of semantic convention groups (i.e. [`GroupSpec`]).

groups.description: A collection of semantic convention groups or [`GroupSpec`].

AnyValueSpec.description: The AnyValueTypeSpec is a specification of a value that can be of any type.

brief.description: A brief description of the value

examples.description: Sequence of examples for the value or single example value. If only a single example is provided, it can directly be reported without encapsulating it into a sequence/dictionary.

id.description: String that uniquely identifies the enum entry.

note.description: A more elaborate description of the value. It defaults to an empty string.

requirement_level.description: Specifies if the field is mandatory. Can be "required", "conditionally_required", "recommended" or "opt_in". When omitted, the field is "recommended". When set to "conditionally_required", the string provided as <condition> MUST specify the conditions under which the field is required.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the value.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the value.

AttributeRole.description: The different roles for attributes in groups.

oneOf.description: The attribute is considered identifying for the signal it is associated with.
The attribute is considered descriptive for the signal it is associated with.

AttributeSpec.description: A reference to an attribute or a local definition of an attribute. * For a reference to an attribute, only the `ref` field is required. * For a locally defined attribute, the fields `id`, `type`, `requirement_level`, and `note` are required.

anyOf.description:
Reference to another attribute.

ref MUST have an id of an existing attribute.

brief.description: A brief description of the attribute.

deprecated.description: Specifies if the attribute is deprecated.

examples.description: Sequence of example values for the attribute or single example value. They are required only for string and string array attributes. Example values must be of the same type of the attribute. If only a single example is provided, it can directly be reported without encapsulating it into a sequence/dictionary.

note.description: A more elaborate description of the attribute. It defaults to an empty string.

prefix.description: Specifies the prefix of the attribute. If this parameter is set, the resolved id of the referenced attribute will have group prefix added to it. It defaults to false.

requirement_level.description: Specifies if the attribute is mandatory. Can be "required", "conditionally_required", "recommended" or "opt_in". When omitted, the attribute is "recommended". When set to "conditionally_required", the string provided as <condition> MUST specify the conditions under which the attribute is required.

role.description: Whether the attribute is identifying or descriptive.

sampling_relevant.description: Specifies if the attribute is (especially) relevant for sampling and thus should be set at span start. It defaults to false. Note: this field is experimental.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the attribute. Note that, if stability is missing but deprecated is present, it will automatically set the stability to deprecated. If deprecated is present and stability differs from deprecated, this will result in an error.

tag.description: Associates a tag ("sub-group") to the attribute. It carries no particular semantic meaning but can be used e.g. for filtering in the markdown generator.

brief.description: A brief description of the attribute.

deprecated.description: Specifies if the attribute is deprecated.

examples.description: Sequence of example values for the attribute or single example value. They are required only for string and string array attributes. Example values must be of the same type of the attribute. If only a single example is provided, it can directly be reported without encapsulating it into a sequence/dictionary.

id.description: String that uniquely identifies the attribute.

note.description: A more elaborate description of the attribute. It defaults to an empty string.

requirement_level.description: Specifies if the attribute is mandatory. Can be "required", "conditionally_required", "recommended" or "opt_in". When omitted, the attribute is "recommended". When set to "conditionally_required", the string provided as <condition> MUST specify the conditions under which the attribute is required.

role.description: Whether the attribute is identifying or descriptive.

sampling_relevant.description: Specifies if the attribute is (especially) relevant for sampling and thus should be set at span start. It defaults to false. Note: this field is experimental.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the attribute. Note that, if stability is missing but deprecated is present, it will automatically set the stability to deprecated. If deprecated is present and stability differs from deprecated, this will result in an error.

tag.description: Associates a tag ("sub-group") to the attribute. It carries no particular semantic meaning but can be used e.g. for filtering in the markdown generator.

type.description: Either a string literal denoting the type as a primitive or an array type, a template type or an enum definition.

allow_custom_values.description: Set to false to not accept values other than the specified members. No longer used since semconv 1.27.0.

BasicRequirementLevelSpec.description: The different types of basic requirement levels.

Deprecated.description: The different ways to deprecate an attribute, a metric, ...

oneOf.description: The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been renamed to an existing or a new telemetry object.

note.description: The note to provide more context about the deprecation.

renamed_to.description: The new name of the telemetry object.

oneOf.description:
The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been obsoleted because it no longer exists and has no valid replacement.

The `brief` field should contain the reason why the field has been obsoleted.

note.description: The note to provide more context about the deprecation.

oneOf.description:
The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been deprecated for complex reasons (split, merge, ...) which are currently not precisely defined in the supported deprecation reasons.

The `brief` field should contain the reason for this uncategorized deprecation.

note.description: The note to provide more context about the deprecation.

brief.description: Brief description of the enum entry value. It defaults to the value of id.

id.description: String that uniquely identifies the enum entry.

note.description: Longer description. It defaults to an empty string.

value.description: String, int, or boolean; value of the enum entry.

anyOf.description: List of arrays of integers example.
List of arrays of doubles example.
List of arrays of bools example.
List of arrays of strings example.

GroupSpec.description: Group Spec contain the list of semantic conventions for attributes, metrics, events, spans, etc.

attributes.description: List of attributes that belong to the semantic convention.

body.description: The event body definition Note: only valid if type is event

brief.description: A brief description of the semantic convention.

deprecated.description: Specifies if the semantic convention is deprecated. The string provided as <description> MUST specify why it's deprecated and/or what to use instead. See also stability.

display_name.description: The readable name for attribute groups used when generating registry tables.

entity_associations.description: Which resources this group should be associated with. Note: this is only viable for span, metric and event groups.

events.description: List of strings that specify the ids of event semantic conventions associated with this span semantic convention. Note: only valid if type is span

extends.description: Reference another semantic convention id. It inherits all attributes defined in the specified semantic convention.

id.description: The id that uniquely identifies the semantic convention.

instrument.description: The instrument type that should be used to record the metric. Note that the semantic conventions must be written using the names of the synchronous instrument types (counter, gauge, updowncounter and histogram). For more details: [Metrics semantic conventions - Instrument types](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/main/specification/metrics/semantic_conventions#instrument-types). Note: This field is required if type is metric.

metric_name.description: The metric name as described by the [OpenTelemetry Specification](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/main/specification/metrics/data-model.md#timeseries-model). Note: This field is required if type is metric.

name.description: The name of the event. If not specified, the prefix is used. If prefix is empty (or unspecified), name is required.

note.description: A more elaborate description of the semantic convention. It defaults to an empty string.

prefix.description: Prefix for the attributes for this semantic convention. It defaults to an empty string.

span_kind.description: Specifies the kind of the span. Note: only valid if type is span

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the semantic convention. Note that, if stability is missing but deprecated is present, it will automatically set the stability to deprecated. If deprecated is present and stability differs from deprecated, this will result in an error.

type.description: The type of the semantic convention.

unit.description: The unit in which the metric is measured, which should adhere to the [guidelines](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/main/specification/metrics/semantic_conventions#instrument-units). Note: This field is required if type is metric.

oneOf.description: Attribute group (attribute_group type) defines a set of attributes that can be declared once and referenced by semantic conventions for different signals, for example spans and logs. Attribute groups don't have any specific fields and follow the general semconv semantics.
The metric group semconv is a group where related metric attributes can be defined and then referenced from other metric groups using ref.
A double attribute (double precision floating point (IEEE 754-1985)).
An any type attribute (accepts any valid value).

Stability.description: The level of stability for a definition. Defined in [OTEP-232](https://github.com/open-telemetry/oteps/blob/main/text/0232-maturity-of-otel.md)

oneOf.description: A definition in development. Formally known as experimental.
